intro: Adenocalymma cinereum, commonly known as the black-flowered rock heath. It is a flowering plant native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant features small, tubular flowers that are typically dark purple or black in color, which gives it its common name. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. Adenocalymma cinereum is often found in coastal and inland fynbos vegetation, and it is adapted to withstand dry and nutrient-poor conditions.
